post_text:
It never fails to amaze me how the actions of one person can inspire others. Pam you started the movement, and now theses young ladies have stepped up to help others!

Let’s not focus on what may have changed, or what may be lost. Instead follow their lead, and find your own way to make this a better world for someone else.

Sage and Emma, and everyone else who will help along the way, you make us proud to be Blue Devils!
shared_text:
Blue Devil’s Student Outreach
August 29 at 2:14 PM ·

McDonald Student Outreach is excited to announce the opening of their new food distribution room at MHS!

This room is located in the library next to the CCP lounge and will be open to anyone in the school. Whether you forgot your lunch or need to take food home for the weekend, this food distribution room is for you!

We will have breakfast, lunch and snack items available throughout the school day, as well as groceries that students may take home.

In addition to food, this room will also be stocked with school supplies, hygiene items and the latest Blue Devil Student Outreach news, so that you never miss out!

Make sure to stop by and take advantage of this new addition to our Blue Devils Student Outreach program!

post_text:
It has been a great first week back to school! Thank you to the entire school community for your cooperation and patience as we become adjusted to the new normal.
This week we will host our first varsity competitions for both football and volleyball. We felt that it was important to review our current ticket policy:
• Governor DeWine and Lt. Governor Husted have been consistent in saying that parents and loved ones of the participants should be given priority for access to the contest. As best as we can, we will be mindful of this for both home and visiting parents and loved ones.
• For both football and volleyball contests, which are held at McDonald High School, each participant will… More

post_text:
Dear Students/ Parents of the McDonald Local School District,

I hope that this email finds everyone in your family safe and healthy, and enjoying the warm weather. On our website, at www.mcdonald.k12.oh.us you will find three documents that deal with the Reset and Restart Plans for the McDonald Local School District under the Links tab.

Throughout the process of creating the plan, we have been faced with the reality that it will be impossible to deliver a perfect product. The information on how to open schools changes by the hour, and important questions needed to be answered. Will we be able to meet in a traditional setting? Will we be able to overcome many of the obstacles that we…

post_text:
The McDonald Local Schools Reset and Restart Education plan will be presented to the McDonald Board of Education next Wednesday. This will take place during our regular meeting, which will be broadcast live on our Facebook account. The detailed plans will then be sent home to all parents via e-mail, and will be available on our web site.

The administration will also plan future Facebook Lives to answer as many questions as possible. We deeply appreciate your patience and understanding.

Stay Safe and Be Kind!

post_text:
I hope that this message finds our entire McDonald School Community safe and healthy. As many of you are aware already, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine has released the Reset and Restart Guide for Ohio schools. Since its release, the staff and administration have begun to finalize what we believe will be the best option for the McDonald Local School District. This process has included parent and student surveys, as well as a committee made up of parents, teachers, administration, and board members.

I know that there are many questions that need to be answered for our students and parents as we begin the back to school shopping season. At this time, McDonald Local Schools is planning to…

post_text:
What a great day for the class of 2020!

I want to say thank you to a few of the people who made this event possible.

Mrs. Evans and Mrs. Smith you completely redesigned graduation and pulled it off without a hitch.

Mr. Ronghi your work on the video was outstanding.

Mr. Carkido you adjusted with every obstacle that was thrown your way. Great job! Your work as the pace car wasn’t bad either.

The staff at both buildings, Mrs. Bosheff, Mr. Jones, Mr. Riccitelli, Officer Smith, and Officer Jones thanks for your efforts.

To the graduates of the class of 2020, and your families, we hope that we helped you create a few special memories. Congratulations to all!

Kevin O’Connell

To the graduates of the class of 2020, and your families, we hope that we helped you create a few special memories. Congratulations to all!

Kevin O’Connell

The McDonald Board of Education has rescheduled their regular meeting from May 20, 2020 to May 14, 2020 at 7:00 p.m. The meeting will be held on the McDonald Local Schools Facebook Live as permitted under H.B. 197. The building will be closed to the public.

The districts Facebook account can be accessed directly from our website located at www.mcdonald.k12.oh.us. Once on the site, simply click the Facebook logo and look for the live broadcast.

The agenda and attachments for the meeting will be posted on our district website on May 13, 2020.

post_text:
The year was 1999, as the world was bracing itself for the start of a new millennium with a sense of fear and excitement. Blockbuster video was a weekend hot spot, the Sony Walkman was the way to listen to music, and people still used printed maps and the yellow pages. 1999 also marked the last year that McDonald Local Schools offered a home site for all of their athletic programs.

McDonald Local Schools conducted multiple levy campaigns over the last 20 years for a new athletic complex at the current site. Each levy failed to gain the necessary support to move forward. On November 8, 2016 the residents of McDonald voted to approve a 10 year, 5 mil emergency levy, which will generate 2.6…

The McDonald Local School District Board of Education will hold a work session on Wednesday, April 29, 2020 at 6:00 p.m.
The work session will be held on the McDonald Local Schools Facebook Live as permitted under H.B. 197. In order to stay in compliance with the directives from Governor Mike Dewine and Amy Acton, McDonald High School will be closed to the public.

The districts Facebook account can be accessed directly from our website located at www.mcdonald.k12.oh.us. Once on the site simply click the Facebook logo and look for the live broadcast.

Stay Safe and Be Kind!

post_text:
We at McDonald Local Schools understand the importance of daily nutritious meals. During this extended school closure we want to ensure that our students continue to receive food on a daily basis.

Tomorrow between 10:30 a.m. and 12:00 p.m. we will offer 5 breakfast and 5 lunches to our students in a grab and go bag. While our primary focus will be students on the free and reduced lunch program, any student in grades Kindergarten-12 can pick up a bag for no charge. Pickup location will be on the Roosevelt Elementary drop off lane. Please stay in your car as we will take your students name and then place the bag in your trunk.

Stay Safe and Be Kind!

post_text:
Good Evening,

I hope this post finds everyone safe and healthy. I would also like to welcome you to the official Facebook page of the Blue Devils. This page will be used to provide important updates as we move through an unprecedented time in education.

First, I must thank the entire staff for their dedication and commitment to the students of our district. The halls are quiet for now, but I know that everyone is ready and willing to do whatever it takes to continue to provide learning opportunities for our students as we wait for the buildings to open again.

For our students and families thank you for your patience and understanding as we navigate our way through many challenges. …

For our students and families thank you for your patience and understanding as we navigate our way through many challenges. …
